headline: No evidence of Medicare/Medicaid fraud in Sedecal device recall record
key_facts: Record pertains to a product recall issued by the FDA for a medical device.; The recall cites manufacturing and labeling deficiencies, not billing or reimbursement issues.; No mention of federal program claims (Medicare/Medicaid/TRICARE/VA) or fraudulent billing practices.

headline: Device recall for non‑sterile wound dressings – no evidence of federal program fraud
key_facts: Product: Aquasorb Border Hydrogel Wound Dressing; Recall reason: failed to meet sterility specifications; Manufacturer: DeRoyal Wound Care, Powell, TN

headline: No evidence of Medicare/Medicaid fraud in FDA device recall record
key_facts: Record pertains to an FDA device recall for a sterile disposable head hood.; Recall reason is potential compromise of sterility due to packaging issues.; No mention of billing, claims, or federal program involvement.

headline: Device recall for a GE cervical post with no evidence of federal program fraud
key_facts: GE 4 inch Anterior Cervical Post was recalled due to a weld defect; Recall involved potential device failure under minimal force; No mention of Medicare, Medicaid, or other federal program billing; Record contains only recall information, not claims data

headline: No evidence of Medicare/Medicaid fraud in device recall record
key_facts: Record pertains to a device recall issued by the FDA.; No mention of billing, claims, or federal program participation.; The recall concerns a mechanical failure that could cause injury.

headline: No evidence of Medicare/Medicaid fraud in the Philips CT scanner recall record
key_facts: The record describes a product recall for a Philips CT scanner software issue.; No mention of billing, claims, or federal healthcare programs.; The recall is a safety/quality issue, not a fraudulent claim.
implicated_actors: Philips Medical Systems North America Co.

headline: Device recall of Penumbra Neuron Delivery Catheter – no evidence of false claims or federal program fraud
key_facts: Penumbra Neuron Delivery Catheter was recalled for failure to deliver devices safely; Recall reason: potential patient injury or death due to retained catheter fragments; No mention of Medicare, Medicaid, TRICARE, VA or any federal program billing

headline: FDA device recall of Baxter Colleague infusion pumps – no evidence of false claims or federal program fraud
key_facts: Baxter received an FDA letter ordering recall of Colleague infusion pumps; Recall due to failure to correct device deficiencies in a timely manner; No mention of Medicare, Medicaid, or other federal reimbursement programs
implicated_actors: Baxter Healthcare Corporation, Medication Delivery Division

headline: Device recall for a Medtronic tactile probe – no evidence of false claims or fraud
key_facts: Product is a tactile probe used in spine surgeries; Recall reason: distal end may break off during use; Manufacturer: Medtronic Navigation, Inc.; No mention of Medicare/Medicaid billing or fraudulent claims

headline: Device recall record shows no evidence of Medicare/Medicaid fraud
key_facts: Record pertains to a device recall, not billing or claims activity; No mention of Medicare, Medicaid, TRICARE, VA, or other federal programs; Recall is a regulatory compliance action, not an alleged false claim
